title.narrative: Preparation of Model National Water Profiles for Selected Member States in the Sahel

description.narrative: Inadequate hydrological data hinders an accurate situational analyses and profiles of water resources availability in the Sahel. This affects management, planning, and access to water. The problem with systematic acquisition of hydrological data links to lack of funds, obsolete equipment, inadequate human capacities and security of equipment in the field. Data acquisition has been sporadic often depending on donor-funded projects that terminate when projects end. This activity therefore intends to capture the National Profiles of member states' current situation with water resources management in terms of data acquisition (types and distribution), work force (number and functions), governance, laws, and other important parameters necessary to create a clear picture of their challenges.
